title: Text selection not working in TUI
description: Text selection does not work in the ccmux TUI client. When attempting to click and drag to select text, nothing happens - there is no selection, no highlight, and no ability to copy text. This is not just a visual issue; selection is completely non-functional.
steps_to_reproduce: Start ccmux and attach to a session
Run a command that produces output (e.g., ls -la)
Attempt to click and drag to select text in the terminal output
Attempt to copy with Ctrl+Shift+C or terminal context menu
Observe that nothing is copied (no selection to copy)
expected_behavior: Either native terminal selection should work (if mouse capture is disabled for selection) OR ccmux should implement a copy mode (like tmux's Prefix+[) that allows text selection and copying
actual_behavior: Click and drag does not select text. No text can be copied from the terminal output. Selection is completely non-functional.

evidence.description: No visual selection highlight when clicking and dragging in TUI

root_cause: To be determined. Likely causes: mouse selection events not being captured or handled, no selection state management implemented, mouse events being consumed for other purposes (scroll) but not selection, copy mode (Prefix+[) not implemented, or crossterm mouse capture intercepting selection before terminal can handle it.
impact: Poor user experience - users cannot copy text from ccmux terminal output. This breaks a fundamental terminal workflow of copying command output, error messages, or other text.
